scenario_text.value: Oh, Takuma! Just who I was hoping to see.
What’s up, Shuuji?

I wanted to ask your advice about something.
It occurred to me after I went to thank you.

I really want to get along better with
Lopmon.

But I can’t stand that wimpy attitude of his.
What do you think I should do?

Well, uh, I’m glad you’re asking for advice,
but what makes you so sure that I can help?
I mean, you get along so well with Agumon.

(I guess...but I’m still not sure what to
say...)
What’s key to getting along with monsters?
Patience
An open heart
Facing the obvious.

You know, I think the most important thing is
to be patient and not get upset with him.

I mean, even we can tell when someone’s mad
at us, and that makes it hard to communicate.

So I think the most important thing is to
start by making Lopmon feel comfortable.

Oh, okay. So I should make him feel like it’s
okay to be himself.

Don’t you think it’s all about keeping an
open heart?
An open heart? What do you mean?

Well, you’re the leader, so you must have an
idea how the others might mess up, right?
Sometimes, yeah.

So, if you don’t expect Lopmon to be perfect
either, won’t that make you more forgiving?

Oh, I get it. You think I need to cut him
some more slack.

I mean, I think the answer’s obvious. You
just need to face it.

The two of you are very similar. Especially
in your anxiety and uncertainty.

I am nothing like that pathetic...
No, I shouldn’t say that. It’s true.

You’re right, and those are aspects of myself
that I don’t like. How I can never...

...come to a decision when it counts, or how
I can’t seem to accomplish anything.

Then you already know what you need to do,
don’t you?
Yes, you’re right. I need confidence.

And I need to give Lopmon more confidence.
I guess that starts with me.

Only...I don’t know if I can do it. See?
I just don’t have any confidence.
Well, that’s what I think you need to change.
Yeah, you’re right...

Sorry, I feel like it was a bit rude of me to
say that.
No, that’s fine. Thanks, Takuma.
